adv:path_edges:allow-tmp.notes: Runtime deny likely due to /tmp → /private/tmp canonicalization before PolicyGraph; not modeling VFS symlink resolution in static IR.

adv:path_edges:allow-subpath.notes: Runtime deny likely due to /tmp → /private/tmp canonicalization dominating subpath match; treated as VFS behavior outside PolicyGraph modeling.

adv:path_edges:write-tmp.notes: Write-side allow on /tmp path denied at runtime; mirrors read-side /tmp → /private/tmp canonicalization and treated as VFS behavior outside PolicyGraph modeling.

adv:path_edges:write-subpath.notes: Write-side subpath allow under /tmp denied at runtime; consistent with VFS canonicalization of /tmp → /private/tmp rather than PolicyGraph mismatch.

adv:mach_simple_allow:allow-cfprefsd.notes: mach-lookup for com.apple.cfprefsd.agent now matches runtime; supports mach vocab/op-table alignment for op ID 96.

adv:mach_simple_variants:allow-cfprefsd.notes: Regex/nested variant also matches runtime; reinforces mach-lookup allow/deny semantics.

adv:net_outbound_allow:tcp-loopback.notes: TCP loopback connect denied even in allow profile; stderr shows xcode-select path denial (Operation not permitted), suggesting harness/client constraint rather than a clean network EPERM. Network-outbound remains partial until a clearer allow-path probe succeeds.
